title: Tell me about a memorable walk you took.

korean: 아, 작년 가을에 제주도에서 올레길 걸었던 게 기억에 남아요.
처음엔 그냥 가볍게 걷는 건데 뭐 어렵겠어 했는데요,
근데 바다 옆으로 걸으면서 보는 풍경이 정말 장난 아니었어요.
사진도 엄청 많이 찍고, 중간에 감귤밭도 지나가고 그랬어요.
다리는 좀 아팠지만 친구들이랑 수다 떨면서 걸으니까 금방 지나가더라고요.
걷다가 배고프면 현지 식당에서 고등어 회 먹고 그랬죠.
완주하고 나니까 뭔가 뿌듯하고 성취감도 들더라고요.
그 이후로 걷기가 더 좋아진 것 같아요.
언젠가 올레길 전체 코스를 다 걸어보고 싶어요.
english: Oh, I remember walking the Olle Trail in Jeju Island last fall.
I went on a 2-night 3-day trip to Jeju with my friends.
It was Course 7, I think? Um, we walked from Oedolgae to Wolpyeong Port.
At first, I was like, it's just light walking, how hard could it be,
but when I actually walked it, it was harder than I thought.
But the scenery while walking along the ocean was really no joke.
We took tons of photos and passed through tangerine orchards in between.
My legs hurt a bit, but chatting with friends while walking, time flew by.
When we got hungry while walking, we ate mackerel sashimi at a local restaurant.
After completing it, I felt kind of proud and accomplished.
Since then, I think I've come to like walking even more.
Someday I want to walk all the Olle Trail courses.
